page.title: 16A BILLINGBOROUGH MAN'S DAY
page.content: I get up at half past six and at seven o'clock I walk to the car park to wait for Les and Martin.I go to work in a yellow lorry-type van.I work for Bonshor Construction Ltd. and I always work away from Billingborough. We meet two more men at Grantham where we are working. If it is a hot day I take my vest off. When I get home at half past five I watch cricket and read the paper. After tea I look at my plants and cut the grass. At nine o'clock I go to bed and watch television. In my spare time I play football with my son. I used to manage a football team called Rangers but it took up too much of my time.
